timeline.author: david-allison-1

timeline.bodyText:
It's a little unusual to have an undo without a "do", as having the "undo" close to the "do" means that there's additional mental context when changes to the "do" are made.
I'm not requesting a change now, but would this direction be possible in the future?
timeline.author: david-allison-1

replies.bodyText: I thought about it, but I don't really see how to do it. The trouble is that usually, an "undo" may cancel multiple "undo". E.g. undoing some burying can cancel the burying of a note from the reviewer. It can also undo the burying of multiple selection done in the card browser.
replies.author: Arthur-Milchior

timeline.bodyText: Does this need to be copied? Ditto for the other instances
timeline.author: david-allison-1

replies.bodyText:
What is "this" ? the list of cards ? The card of the list ?
The list was not copied before so I assumed it was not needed here, I tried to stay close to previous code.
The reason why some card are cloned and the list does not need to be cloned/copied is that the card object may potentially evolve, while the list may not. Indeed, the list is is created when UndoBuryCard is called, and the calling code does not even have access to the code anyway.
I guess it may be relevant to request that caller does not change the value sent to the Undoable action, remove the cloning from the Undo classes and move it to their callers, that would make thing more consistent
replies.author: Arthur-Milchior

replies.bodyText:
"This" meaning either the list or the cards in the list.
Presumably it wasn't cloned previously, so it should be fine, but it'd be unintuitive if the collection was mutated after the class was created.
replies.author: david-allison-1

replies.bodyText:
I added a comment to require that elements sent to constructor are never mutated later. That's usually the case, and the cases where the element may be mutated are the exceptions right now. Cloning everything would be uselessly costly.
Of course, that assumes the next programmer will read comments...
replies.author: Arthur-Milchior

timeline.author: david-allison-1

timeline.bodyText: Could we change the -1 to a const/enum if we're doing a lot of work here
timeline.author: david-allison-1

replies.bodyText:
It's not clear how to do it, because -1 and 0 has special meaning while positive numbers represent card id.
In OCaml or Haskell I would simply do an algebraic type which is either 0, -1, or card id. But I don't know java enough to do how to do it here
replies.author: Arthur-Milchior

replies.bodyText: Easier to use a const - may be possible as an enum
replies.author: david-allison-1

replies.bodyText: I added a class with three subclass, so that the one subclass for card id has an id.
replies.author: Arthur-Milchior

timeline.message:

This will be used for testing
NF: remove a useles object for BURY_CARD

NF: method UndoType

This will be used for testing

timeline.bodyText: Best to use an enum, const, or switch back to the long, instanceof is typically a code smell
timeline.author: david-allison-1

replies.bodyText: I am sorry, but I really don't see how to use an enum if we need to store an arbitrary value
replies.author: Arthur-Milchior
